event:
That was the most complete Giants victory I have seen in years.  Almost total domination in every phase of play.  It would have been another shutout except for a Sinorice Moss fumble and a very bad call by the refs a few plays later, when a quick whistle (which no one heard) negated a Giants fumble recovery and touchdown.

I'll say this for the Raiders, though.  They have a very good punter.

The NFL can be merciless.  It was only a few years ago the Raiders were playing in the Superbowl, but since then...

JaMarcus Russell is no Rich Gannon.  He did manage to complete more than half of his passes today, in between getting sacked and losing fumbles.  Gods, what an awful quarterback.  And the rumor is that Zombie Al won't let the coaches bench him.

Eli had a perfect passer rating.  Even David Carr looked good.  And Mario Manningham and Hakeem Nicks both played great games.  Our young wideouts are really coming along.  And the running game looked great today.

Of coursse, the real test will be next week, when the G-Men face the undefeated Saints.

comments.article: beat the saints!  beat the saints!  beat the saints!
comments.subject: as a Falcons fan, I would just like to say

comments.article:
"They have a very good punter."

That's the good news (for them). The bad news is, they really need one.

Guess there's a bright spot somewhere! I feel bad for Darren McFadden.  The Raiders have him in an awful HB rotation, so he's never getting enough carries to showcase his talent. Plus, they're always playing catch-up, which forces Off-the-Marcus Russell to have to throw too often.  He makes Ryan Leaf look like a Hall-of-Famer.
So many horrible teams this year. Just watched my Eagles play Tampa, next week it's Oakland, and then we get Washington. Oh the drama.
comments.subject: Terrible

comments.article: So true about the horrible teams this year.  But hey, we'll be 5-1 when we face GRRM's Giants.
comments.subject: Re: Terrible

comments.article: Can I just get the *tiniest* little bit of love for my poor, hapless Cleveland Browns?  They got their first win today, and although it was not a thing of beauty, it felt like the Super Bowl here in the land of Cleve!
its a tough division.. oh yeah and my Bengals are leading it!!!! HOODAY

And Mr. Sneed is more undead than Al Davis (barely.)  But the Saints are going to be tough - Multifaceted QB with weapons + tough defense.  The real question is how is Eli's heel and will the Saints be able to expose any lingering effects of a pesky injury.
comments.subject: My highschool team is more disciplined then the raiders

comments.article: They replayed the fumble that was not a fumble and beefed up the sound, and I swear the whistle didn't sound until after the ball was already in the hands of the Giants.  So it goes.
Wow, Raiders. Wow. Maybe you should just let your cheerleaders play.

comments.upictitle: Names Is For Tombstones, Baby: Rocketeer
comments.article: Ah, the Raiders.  We get 'em next week.  After today's blowout of the Bucs, it's almost like three bye weeks in a row for the Eagles.

As horrible as the Raiders have been in the past, that was the worst I've ever seen them.

Fortunately the Giants didn't get any serious dings or injuries. It was a good scrimmage. It was a perfect situation for Carr.

I have no doubt the coaches and team leaders won't let the rest of the team get cocky off of this game.

The difference between this year and the last few is this year Eli is making the receivers better due to his fine play.  The last few years Eli relied on Plexico to cover for some poor play.  Eli's really stepped it up and for the first time has moved into that top 5 quarterback group.  If he keeps playing like this, combined with Tom Coughlin's fine coaching that keeps the team focus, this team should dominate the NFC.  Big test against the Saints next week, should be a great game.

It's funny how things change.  Before the Giants SB year, there were all kinds of calls for Coughlin to be fired.  He was too tough on the players.  Eli was too inconsistent to be the franchise QB they needed.  They weren't winning big games. Coughlin's coaching style "forced" Tiki Barber to retire at the top of his game.  Blah, blah, blah!  Now the Giants are one of the top 5 teams in the NFL, Eli turned out to be that franchise guy, and no-one is complaining about the coaching anymore.  I just hope the lack of competition over the past three weeks doesn't hurt the G-men when they travel to New Orleans next week.
comments.subject: Re: 44-7

comments.article: I think most of the fans in New Orleans will be rooting for the Saints and for Eli.

Not next week...

Next week, we hope to make Eli stare at the Dome ceiling as much as his father did for years. :)

(Then we can go back to our regularly scheduled Manning love)

Enough celebration. My Bills really have laid an egg. I cannot imagine that Dick Juron will keep his job much longer, and I think a lot of people want to see Bobby April rewarded for being the best special teams coach in the business.

I've had enough of Trent "Captain Checkdown" Edwards. I really thought he might be the real deal, but the kid refuses to the middle of the field, will not throw mid-range passes. Most of his passes are to his running backs, and nearly all completions are either at or behind the line of scrimmage. Yes, the offensive line is in shambles, yes the defense is destroyed by injuries for the second time in three years, but at some point we need a change. The attitude just isn't there. Three games this week I've seen Trent Edwards with the ball in his hands for the final play of the game, and have watched him throw the ball to Freddie Jackson at the line of scrimmage all three times.

GAH! Who cursed me to be a Bills fan??
comments.subject: Just to darken the mood a bit...

comments.article: Yeah, my Steelers beat the Lions today, who actually look much better than the Raiders. Next week's game (Giants-Saints) is going to be very interesting.
Well, as a Saint fan, I would like to say....Who Dat!

Quote from Drew Carey: "Fat broke ugly guys score more than the Browns do." Unbelievable that the Browns managed to beat the Bills despite being limited to 2 (count them, 2) completions. From ESPN: "The Browns won despite Derek Anderson completing only 11.8 percent of his passes, the lowest completion percentage by a quarterback in a win (minimum 15 attempts) since the merger."

I wouldn't worry too much about the Jets tomorrow night - they're playing us, and we suck this year.
'Nuff said.
comments.subject: Who dat?

comments.article: In fairness to Zombie Al, Russell's backups are apparently even worse. Charlie Frye and Bruce Gradkowski I believe are their names.

Both Frye and Gradkowski have played competently in the past. Yes, JaMarcus has more "upside," but right now I think either F or G would do better. They certainly could not do worse.

And the Raiders cut Jeff Garcia before the first game. Garcia could certainly have given them a chance.

Didn't they also have Dante Culpepper a couple seasons back? Culpepper played today for the Lions and did pretty well. Still some gas in that tank, I think.

"Upside" in this case may be a phantom. JaMarcus has a huge cannon of an arm (that's what Zombie Al loves), but none of the other attributes of a good QB. Davis is still trying to revive the vertical game of the 70s, which was great in its day, but does not work in today's NFL. And Russell is certainly not the second coming of Daryl the Mad Bomber Lamonica.

The Raiders sure do have a swell punter, though.

The Indianapolis Mannings beat the pudding out of my team. Hats off to the Colts, er Mannings and their fans.

Roddy White and Miles Austin had a great day with over 200 yards receiving and two TD's apiece.

And, finally, screw you Jack Del Rio! Thanks for taking Sims-Walker out of the Jags/Seahawks game right before game time. You could have screwed my fantasy team up, and if the "team violation" wasn't anything other than a heinous crime, you deserved to get beat.
Heh...I doubt it would have mattered.  I have M-J Drew on one of my fantasy teams, but I'll take the Seattle W any day.
The Raiders will never see another winning season until Uncle Al goes away.....
WHO-DEY
What a difference a week (and a QB) makes! The Seahawks stomped all over Jacksonville 41-0.  Rest those ribs, Matt!  We can't win without you!
We needed that win.  Three losses in a row hurts!

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: Seeing Russell struggle made my weekend.
Has he had a game where he hasn't struggled since leaving Baton Rouge?
I was enjoying my Vikes go 5-0 but I now find I'm following the Jets and Giants on the NFL  gameday site because of you.

http://www.bangcartoon.com/2009/cluck.htm

http://www.bangcartoon.com/2009/skirt.htm

The first one pays some homage to Foghorn Leghorn, with Rex Ryan in the starting role... the second si just general commentary on the new QB rules....
comments.subject: Some funny Belicheat / princess Brady stuff...
